datafield.subfield: Arranged in six series:1. Big Ten Commercials 2. Freedom Of Information Act 3. Outreach Planning and Development 4. Michigan Advancement Council 5. Michigan Public Radio 6. Michigan Road Scholars.

Morrissey joined teh University of Michigan as freedom of information officer and director of special projects for university relations in 1994. In 1995, with the advent of a new outreach initiative at the university, Morrissey became director of state outreach within the university relations office, while retaining his FOIA duties. One of the major initiatives Morrissey led as director of state outreach was the Michigan Road Scholars program. He was also involved with Michigan Advancement Council a professional organization for advancement officials at public universities in Michigan, as well as many other general outreach and university relations projects. Morrissey held the positions of state outreach director and chief freedom of information officer until his retirement from the university in 2004.

Papers include documentation of projects undertaken by Morrissey, including the Michigan Road Scholars (MRS) program, his work with the Michigan Advancement Council, advertisements sponsored by the Big Ten, FOIA Information, Michigan Public Radio, and general outreach planning and development. Includes agendas, meeting minutes, research and plannin documents, and correspondence; itineraries, applications, and evaluations of the Road Scholars program, and a wide variety of other administrative documentation of Morrissey's work, especially the MRS program.
